sources.title: "The Impossible Convicts" (1906) cinematographer Billy Bitzer
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "The Impossible Convicts" is a very short comedy.  The film is included in our program to illustrate the work of our star cinematographer Billy Bitzer.  In addition to being the cinematographer, IMDB gives Billy Bitzer credit as a director and if this is confirmed "The Impossible Convicts" would be one of very few films, for which Billy Bitzer receives this distinction. Get ready to see a very unusual film, and perhaps a truly amazing one. Directed by                       unknown Cinematography by         Billy Bitzer Starring                             unknown Distributed by                   Biograph Company Release date                      January 27, 1906 Country                             United States Running time                    3 m. metadata.Plot: Four prisoners, in convicts' stripes, march backwards down stairs and, under the watchful eyes of guards, hop backwards into their cells. Later, one overpowers a guard and springs his three pals. But, will they be able to pull off an escape? Other guards come to the aid of their fallen comrade before all four felons can flee. Guards and convicts spring forward and backward out of cells, up and down stairs, and into and out of freedom.
